Name: White Chocolate Raspberry Cheesecake
Author: Cindy Catudal Shank
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'chocolate cookie crumbs', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'melted'}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'frozen raspberries', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': '10 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'water', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cornstarch', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white chocolate chips', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'half-and-half cream', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cream cheese', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'softened 8 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'eggs', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'vanilla extract', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['1 cup chocolate cookie crumbs', '0.25 cup butter, melted', '3 tablespoons white sugar', '1 (10 ounce) package frozen raspberries', '0.5 cup water', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '2 teaspoons cornstarch', '2 cups white chocolate chips', '0.5 cup half-and-half cream', '3 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened', '0.5 cup white sugar', '3 large eggs', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Instructions: ['Gather the ingredients.', 'To make the crust: Mix together cookie crumbs, melted butter, and sugar in a medium bowl. Press mixture into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.', 'To make the raspberry sauce: Combine raspberries, water, sugar, and cornstarch in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and continue boiling until sauce is thick, about 5 minutes. Strain through a mesh strainer to remove seeds. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).', 'To make the cheesecake filling: Melt white chocolate chips with half-and-half in a metal bowl over a pan of simmering water  stir occasionally until smooth.', 'Mix together cream cheese and sugar in a large bowl until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time. Blend in vanilla and melted white chocolate mixture. Pour 1/2 of the batter over crust.', 'Spoon 3 tablespoons raspberry sauce over batter. Pour remaining cheesecake batter on top. Spoon 3 tablespoons raspberry sauce over batter. Swirl batter with the tip of a knife to create a marbled effect.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until filling is set, 55 to 60 minutes. Cool cheesecake at room temperature, then cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, 8 hours to overnight.', 'Remove cheesecake from the pan and serve with remaining raspberry sauce.']

Name: Chocolate Cheesecake
Author: JJOHN32
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'graham cracker crumbs', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'melted butter', 'quantity': '0.33333334326744', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'semisweet chocolate chips', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cream cheese', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'softened 8 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'eggs', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'sour cream', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'all-purpose flour', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'vanilla extract', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'sour cream', 'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': 'optional'}, {'ingredient': 'shavings for garnish', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'chocolate', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['2 cups graham cracker crumbs', '0.33333334326744 cup melted butter', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '1 cup semisweet chocolate chips', '3 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened', '1 cup white sugar', '3 eggs', '0.5 cup sour cream', '3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract', '1/2 cup sour cream', '1 tablespoon white sugar (Optional)', 'chocolate shavings for garnish']
Instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Mix cookie crumbs, melted butter, and 2 tablespoons sugar in a medium bowl until well combined. Press mixture into the bottom and 2 inches up the sides of a 9-inch springform pan. Place in the refrigerator for crust to set, about 30 minutes.', 'Place chocolate chips in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes. Set aside.', 'Beat cream cheese and 1 cup sugar in a large bowl until smooth and creamy. Blend in eggs one at a time, mixing after each addition until just incorporated. Gradually pour in melted chocolate, beating on low speed until well blended. Add 1/2 cup sour cream, flour, and vanilla. Blend until smooth, then pour into crust.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until center is set and filling is firm, 55 to 60 minutes. Turn the oven off. Cool cheesecake in the oven for 1 hour without opening the door. Remove cheesecake to the counter and cool completely at room temperature. Transfer cheesecake to the refrigerator and chill for several hours to overnight.', 'Stir 1/2 cup sour cream and 1 tablespoon sugar together in a small bowl until well combined. Spread over chilled cheesecake before serving  garnish with chocolate shavings.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '372 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '43 g', 'Cholesterol': '87 mg', 'Fiber': '1 g', 'Protein': '5 g', 'Saturated Fat': '12 g', 'Sodium': '194 mg', 'Sugar': '32 g', 'Fat': '21 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Chef John's Fried Green Tomatoes
Author: John Mitzewich
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'green tomato', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'misc': '12 inch'}, {'ingredient': 'salt', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cornmeal', 'quantity': '0.75', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'bread crumbs', 'quantity': '0.75', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'black pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'freshly', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'cayenne pepper', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'misc': 'or to taste'}, {'ingredient': 'eggs', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'milk', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'all-purpose flour', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'vegetable oil', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'sweet pickle relish', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'mayonnaise', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'sauce', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': 'or to taste hot'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['4 (1/2 inch) slices green tomato', '1 teaspoon salt', '0.75 cup cornmeal', '0.75 cup bread crumbs', 'freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '2 eggs', '2 tablespoons milk', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 tablespoon butter', '2 tablespoons sweet pickle relish', '2 tablespoons mayonnaise', '2 teaspoons hot sauce, or to taste']
Instructions: ['Place tomato slices on a rack over paper towels. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon salt. Let slices stand for salt to draw out excess moisture, about 15 minutes.', 'Mix cornmeal and bread crumbs together in a shallow bowl  stir in remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper to taste. Beat eggs with milk in a separate bowl. Place flour into a third bowl.', 'Pat tomato slices dry with paper towels. Lay slices one at a time in flour  flip to coat both sides. Let slices rest in flour for about 30 seconds. Remove each slice and dip in egg mixture, then in cornmeal mixture, coating both sides. Coat tomato slices in cornmeal-bread crumb mixture on both sides, pressing into crevices with a fork. Rest tomatoes on rack to let coating set, about 10 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, combine sweet pickle relish, mayonnaise, and hot sauce in a small bowl to make remoulade sauce. Set aside.', 'Place a large nonstick skillet over medium heat  heat vegetable oil with butter until butter melts, bubbles, and sizzles. Fry tomatoes in hot butter-oil mixture until slightly soft and golden brown, using a spatula and a fork to flip, 3 to 4 minutes per side.', 'Transfer fried green tomatoes to a serving platter and serve with remoulade sauce.']

Name: Basque Cheesecake
Author: John Mitzewich

Instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).', 'Butter a 9-inch cake pan. Cut a sheet of parchment paper large enough to line the inside of the pan by a few extra inches. Trim away any excess paper from the sides until you have an inch or two of overhang.', 'Combine cream cheese, sugar, flour, and salt in a bowl  stir and smear together with a spatula until very smooth and creamy.', 'Add vanilla and 1 egg  whisk to combine. Name: Melt in Your Mouth Blueberry Cake
Author: irenedee
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '0.75', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'divided'}, {'ingredient': 'salt', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'vanilla extract', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'yolks', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'all-purpose flour', 'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'baking powder', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'milk', 'quantity': '0.33333334326744', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'blueberries', 'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': 'fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'all-purpose flour', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'whites', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'egg', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['0.5 cup butter', '0.75 cup white sugar, divided', '0.25 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '2 egg yolks', '1.5 cups all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '0.33333334326744 cup milk', '1.5 cups fresh blueberries', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '2 egg whites', '1 tablespoon white sugar']
Instructions: ['Gather all ingredients and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8-inch pan.', 'Beat butter and 1/2 cup sugar together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until soft and fluffy  mix in vanilla and salt. Add egg yolks and beat until creamy.', 'Combine 1 ½ cups flour and baking powder in a bowl  add alternately with milk to creamed mixture.', 'Toss blueberries with 1 tablespoon flour in a small bowl. Add to the batter and fold in gently.', 'Beat egg whites in a separate bowl until soft peaks form. Add remaining 1/4 cup of sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, and beat until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into cake batter.', 'Pour batter into the prepared pan. Sprinkle remaining 1 tablespoon sugar over top.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, about 50 minutes.', 'Serve and enjoy!']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '206 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '29 g', 'Cholesterol': '55 mg', 'Fiber': '1 g', 'Protein': '3 g', 'Saturated Fat': '5 g', 'Sodium': '157 mg', 'Sugar': '16 g', 'Fat': '9 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Green Bean Casserole Remix
Author: chocoholic1
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'frozen cut green beans', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'thawed 9 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'bacon', 'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'slices', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'mushrooms', 'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'small', 'misc': 'chopped fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'garlic powder', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'onion powder', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'half-and-half cream', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'parmesan cheese', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'grated'}, {'ingredient': 'and pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['2 (9 ounce) packages frozen cut green beans, thawed', '10 slices bacon', '10 small fresh mushrooms, chopped', '0.5 teaspoon garlic powder', '0.5 teaspoon onion powder', '1 cup half-and-half cream', '0.25 cup grated Parmesan cheese', 'salt and pepper to taste']
Instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place green beans into a 1 quart or similar sized casserole dish.', 'Fry bacon in a large deep skillet over medium-high heat until browned and crispy. Remove to drain on paper towels. Drain off some of the grease, leaving enough to coat the bottom of the pan. Add mushrooms to the grease in the pan and season with garlic powder and onion powder. Cook and stir until tender, about 4 minutes.', 'Pour the half-and-half into the pan with the mushrooms and stir to scrape the bacon flavor from the bottom of the pan. Simmer until thickened slightly, about 5 minutes. Pour this mixture over the green beans. Crumble bacon over the top and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper.', 'Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the sauce is bubbling and the top is toasted.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '182 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '8 g', 'Cholesterol': '35 mg', 'Fiber': '2 g', 'Protein': '10 g', 'Saturated Fat': '6 g', 'Sodium': '449 mg', 'Sugar': '3 g', 'Fat': '12 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: One Egg Lemon Pound Cake
Author: Kimberley
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'all-purpose flour', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'baking powder', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'salt', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'egg', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'milk', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'vanilla extract', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'lemon extract', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['2 cups all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon salt', '0.5 cup butter', '1 egg', '1 cup milk', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 teaspoon lemon extract']
Instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) grease and flour an 8x4 inch loaf pan.', 'In a large bowl, mix flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Cut in butter. Break 1 egg into a measuring cup and then fill to the 1 cup line with milk. Add to dry ingredients and beat well. Add vanilla and lemon flavoring.', 'Pour batter into an 8x4 inch loaf pan. Name: Gruyere Potato Gratin
Author: Cindy Krafft
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': 'softened'}, {'ingredient': 'potatoes', 'quantity': '2.5', 'unit': 'pounds', 'misc': 'peeled and thinly sliced'}, {'ingredient': 'onions', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'and pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'gruyere cheese', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'shredded'}, {'ingredient': 'white wine', 'quantity': '0.75', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'water', 'quantity': '0.33333334326744', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'heavy cream', 'quantity': '0.75', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['2 tablespoons softened butter', '2.5 pounds potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced', '2 large onions, chopped', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 cup shredded Gruyere cheese', '0.75 cup white wine', '0.33333334326744 cup water', '0.75 cup heavy cream']
Instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with softened butter.', 'Toss potato slices and chopped onions with salt and pepper  spread 1/3 of the potato mixture into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle half of the Gruyère cheese over potatoes, then add another layer of potatoes. Sprinkle on remaining Gruyère cheese, then layer remaining potatoes on top. Mix water and wine together  pour over potatoes in the dish. Cover the dish with aluminum foil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes are tender, about 1 hour 15 minutes. Remove foil and pour cream evenly over potatoes. Bake, uncovered, for an additional 15 minutes to thicken cream and brown the top.']

Name: Creamy Mushroom Stew
Author: lutzflcat
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'unsalted butter', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'onions', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'carrot', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'large', 'misc': 'peeled and diced'}, {'ingredient': 'white button mushrooms', 'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'misc': 'sliced'}, {'ingredient': 'baby bella mushrooms', 'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'misc': 'sliced'}, {'ingredient': 'frozen peas', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'garlic', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'misc': 'minced'}, {'ingredient': 'thyme', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'dried'}, {'ingredient': 'beef broth', 'quantity': '0.33333334326744', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'sherry', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': 'dry'}, {'ingredient': 'low-sodium soy sauce', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'tomato paste', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'heavy cream', 'quantity': '0.33333334326744', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'and black pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': 'freshly ground'}, {'ingredient': 'parsley', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': 'chopped fresh'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['2 tablespoons unsalted butter', '0.5 cup chopped onions', '0.5 large carrot, peeled and diced', '8 ounces white button mushrooms, sliced', '8 ounces baby bella mushrooms, sliced', '0.5 cup frozen peas', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '0.5 teaspoon dried thyme', '0.33333334326744 cup beef broth', '2 tablespoons dry sherry', '1 tablespoon low-sodium soy sauce', '1 tablespoon tomato paste', '0.33333334326744 cup heavy cream', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley']
Instructions: ['Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in onions and carrot and cook for about 3 minutes. Add mushrooms, stirring occasionally, and cook for about another 5 minutes. Stir in the peas, garlic, and thyme. Keep cooking until the moisture from the mushrooms starts to evaporate, about 4 minutes.', 'Stir in the beef broth, sherry, soy sauce, and tomato paste until well combined. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer for about 5 minutes.', 'Pour heavy cream over the mushroom mixture, and season with salt and pepper. Stir until well combined and mixture starts to thicken, 2 to 3 minutes. If stew is too thick, add a little beef broth. If too thin, allow to cook down for a while longer until you arrive at your desired consistency.', 'Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '191 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '14 g', 'Cholesterol': '42 mg', 'Fiber': '3 g', 'Protein': '6 g', 'Saturated Fat': '8 g', 'Sodium': '319 mg', 'Sugar': '5 g', 'Fat': '14 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Fried Rice and Beans (Gallo Pinto)
Author: tconstantine
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'black beans', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'misc': 'dry'}, {'ingredient': 'garlic', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'misc': 'mashed'}, {'ingredient': 'leaf', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bay', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'oregano', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'dried'}, {'ingredient': 'salt', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'oil', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'or as needed'}, {'ingredient': 'onion', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': 'finely chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'rice', 'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': 'cooked'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['1 pound dry black beans', '2 cloves garlic, mashed', '1 bay leaf', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon oil, or as needed', '2 tablespoons finely chopped onion', '1.5 cups cooked rice']
Instructions: ['Go through beans and pick out any with holes or rocks. Transfer beans to a large container and cover with several inches of cool water  let soak for at least 1 hour, or overnight.', 'Rinse beans and dump water out. Transfer to a large pan and cover with fresh water by 2 inches. Add garlic and bay leaf and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook until tender, about 1 hour, adding oregano and salt during the last few minutes. Reserve a few spoons of "caldo" (cooking juice) as it cooks.', 'Measure 1/2 cup cooked beans for gallo pinto and reserve remaining beans for another use.', 'For one serving of gallo pinto: Heat oil in a skillet over medium-low heat. Add onion and saute until dark but not burned, 8 to 10 minutes. Add 1/2 cup cooked black beans along with 2 to 3 tablespoons "caldo." Stir in rice and cook until it starts to get crispy 3 to 5 minutes.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '1918 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '355 g', 'Cholesterol': '', 'Fiber': '71 g', 'Protein': '105 g', 'Saturated Fat': '3 g', 'Sodium': '2353 mg', 'Sugar': '11 g', 'Fat': '12 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Scrumptious Carrot Cupcakes
Author: Mwluvsfrance
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'spray', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'cooking', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'all-purpose flour', 'quantity': '2.5', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cinnamon', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'fine sea salt', 'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'baking soda', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'baking powder', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'allspice', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'ginger', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'carrots', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': 'or to taste shredded'}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'light brown sugar', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'packed'}, {'ingredient': 'eggs', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'buttermilk', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'vanilla extract', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'vegetable oil', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'confectioners sugar', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cream cheese', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'softened 8 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'at room temperature'}, {'ingredient': 'vanilla extract', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['cooking spray', '2.5 cups all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', '1.5 teaspoons fine sea salt', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon ground allspice', '1 teaspoon ground ginger', '4 cups shredded carrots, or to taste', '1 cup white sugar', '1 cup packed light brown sugar', '3 eggs', '0.5 cup buttermilk', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '0.5 cup vegetable oil', "2 cups confectioners' sugar", '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '0.5 cup butter, at room temperature', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line muffin tins with paper liners and spray liners with vegetable oil spray to prevent cupcakes from sticking to liners.', 'Combine flour, cinnamon, salt, baking soda, baking powder, allspice, and ginger in the bowl of a food processor  mix to incorporate ingredients, 5 to 10 seconds. Transfer to a bowl and toss in shredded carrots.', 'Use the food processor to combine white sugar, brown sugar, eggs, buttermilk, and vanilla extract with a paddle attachment. Drizzle in the vegetable oil while the food processor is still running. Add to flour mixture and mix just until combined.', 'Scoop batter into the prepared muffin tins to fill the cups 2/3 full.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, 17 to 20 minutes. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool, about 20 minutes.', "Beat cream cheese and butter together with the paddle attachment of a stand mixer on medium speed. Stir in vanilla extract. Add confectioners' sugar gradually on low speed  turn to high speed and mix until smooth and creamy.", 'Spread frosting over cooled cupcakes.']

Author: Meagan Siddiqui
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'peppers', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'jalapeno', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'poblano peppers', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'olive oil', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': 'divided'}, {'ingredient': 'celery', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stalks', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'garlic', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'onion', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'salt', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'black pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'ground', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'condensed reduced-fat reduced-sodium cream of chicken soup', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': '1075 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'condensed reduced-fat reduced-sodium cream of celery soup', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': '1075 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'reduced-sodium chicken broth', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'chili powder', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cumin', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'chicken - skin and bones removed', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cooked', 'misc': 'meat cut into bite-size pieces 3 pound'}, {'ingredient': 'corn tortillas', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'cut into strips 10 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'monterey jack cheese', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'divided 8 ounce shredded'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['2 jalapeno peppers', '2 large poblano peppers', '2 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '2 stalks celery, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 large onion, chopped', '1 teaspoon salt', 'ground black pepper to taste', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed reduced-fat reduced-sodium cream of chicken soup', '1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed reduced-fat reduced-sodium cream of celery soup', '0.25 cup reduced-sodium chicken broth', '2 tablespoons chili powder', '1 tablespoon cumin', '1 (3 pound) cooked chicken - skin and bones removed, meat cut into bite-size pieces', '1 (10 ounce) package corn tortillas, cut into strips', '1 (8 ounce) package shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided']
Instructions: ['Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Coat the jalapeno and poblano peppers with 1 tablespoon olive oil and arrange on the prepared baking sheet.', 'Roast peppers in the oven until charred, 30 to 40 minutes, turning once about half way through the cooking time. Remove peppers from oven and set aside to cool.', 'Reduce oven heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.', 'Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in the celery, garlic and onion  cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Season with 1 teaspoon salt and black pepper to taste. While the onion mixture is cooking, remove the skin and seeds from the cooled peppers, then coarsely chop. Stir peppers into the skillet and cook for 1 to 2 minutes more. Stir in the cream of chicken, cream of celery, chicken broth, chili powder, cumin, and chicken meat.', 'Make a single layer using half of the strips of tortilla on the prepared baking dish. Spread half of the chicken mixture on top. Sprinkle with salt to taste, and top with half of the Monterey Jack cheese. Repeat the layers, finishing with the remaining half of the Monterey Jack cheese.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is bubbly and the edges are golden brown, 25 to 35 minutes. Allow the dish to rest for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '437 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '19 g', 'Cholesterol': '107 mg', 'Fiber': '3 g', 'Protein': '35 g', 'Saturated Fat': '8 g', 'Sodium': '596 mg', 'Sugar': '2 g', 'Fat': '24 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Pancetta Wrapped Shrimp with Chipotle Vinaigrette and Cilantro Oil
Author: Ryan Nomura
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'cilantro', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'misc': 'rinsed'}, {'ingredient': 'canola oil', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'honey', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'lime juice', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': 'fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'chipotle pepper', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'canned', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'adobo sauce from canned chipotle peppers', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'lemon juice', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'rice vinegar', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'garlic', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'canola oil', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'extra shrimp', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'pounds', 'misc': 'peeled and deveined tail left on 16-20 large'}, {'ingredient': 'pancetta', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'misc': 'thinly sliced'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['1 bunch cilantro, rinsed', '1 cup canola oil', '1 teaspoon honey', '4 teaspoons fresh lime juice', 'Salt to taste', '1 canned chipotle pepper', '1 tablespoon adobo sauce from canned chipotle peppers', '0.25 cup fresh lemon juice', '0.5 cup rice vinegar', '1 clove garlic', '1 cup canola oil', 'Salt to taste', '3 pounds extra large shrimp (16-20), peeled and deveined, tail left on', '2 pounds thinly sliced pancetta']
Instructions: ['Prepare cilantro oil by pureeing cilantro, canola oil, honey, lime juice, and salt to taste until smooth  pour into a bowl or bottle, and set aside.', 'Prepare the chipotle vinaigrette by pureeing the chipotle pepper, adobo sauce, lemon juice, rice vinegar, and garlic in a blender until smooth. With the blender running, slowly pour in the canola oil, and puree until creamy. Season to taste with salt, and set aside.', 'Preheat a grill for medium heat.', 'Cut the pancetta slices in half. Wrap a half slice of pancetta around each shrimp to cover. Grill until the pancetta has crisped, and the shrimp has turned opaque, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels.', 'To serve, arrange cooked shrimp on a warmed serving platter or individual plates, and drizzle with chipotle vinaigrette and cilantro oil.']

Ingredients_Raw: ["cooking spray (such as Baker's Joy®)", '3.25 cups white whole wheat flour', '2 tablespoons lightly packed dark brown sugar', '2 teaspoons baking soda', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '0.25 teaspoon ground nutmeg', '2 cups pumpkin puree', '1.125 cups unsweetened applesauce', '1 cup chilled apple cider', '4 large eggs, slightly beaten', '0.75 cup raisins', '0.5 cup chopped walnuts']
Instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat 24 muffin cups with cooking spray.', 'Combine flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, pumpkin pie spice, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a large mixing bowl. Add pumpkin, applesauce, apple cider, eggs, raisins, and walnuts. Stir until thoroughly combined. Divide batter evenly between the prepared muffin cups.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, or the center springs back when touched, 22 to 25 minutes.']

Name: Easy Creamy Mushrooms
Author: Marianne
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'onion', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'misc': 'finely chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'assorted wild mushrooms', 'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'pounds', 'misc': 'sliced'}, {'ingredient': 'salt', 'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'flat-leaf parsley', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': 'or more to taste chopped fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'white wine', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'splash', 'misc': 'dry'}, {'ingredient': 'heavy whipping cream', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'or more to taste'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['2 tablespoons butter', '1 medium onion, finely chopped', '1.5 pounds assorted sliced wild mushrooms', 'salt', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, or more to taste', '1 splash dry white wine', '0.5 cup heavy whipping cream, or more to taste']
Instructions: ['Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat and cook onion until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook for 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in parsley and pour in white wine. Add cream and season with salt.']

Author: Buckwheat Queen
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'celeriac', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'peeled and cut into 12-inch sticks'}, {'ingredient': 'olive oil', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'and black pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'tomato paste', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'tomato sauce', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'apple cider vinegar', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'harissa', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'brown rice syrup', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'coriander', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'garlic powder', 'quantity': '0.125', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'onion powder', 'quantity': '0.125', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'fine sea salt', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'water', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['0.5 celeriac, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch sticks', '1 tablespoon olive oil', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '0.25 cup tomato paste', '2 tablespoons tomato sauce', '1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', '2 teaspoons harissa', '2 teaspoons brown rice syrup', '0.25 teaspoon ground coriander', '0.125 teaspoon garlic powder', '0.125 teaspoon onion powder', '1 pinch fine sea salt', '1 teaspoon water']
Instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 225 degrees F (99 degrees C). Line a large baking sheet with aluminum foil and place in the oven to preheat.', 'Place celeriac in a bowl  drizzle olive oil over and season with salt and black pepper. Toss fries to coat evenly.', 'Remove baking sheet from the hot oven. Transfer fries to the baking sheet in a single layer with some space between them.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.', 'While fries bake, combine tomato paste, tomato sauce, apple cider vinegar, harissa, brown rice syrup, coriander, garlic powder, onion powder, and sea salt in a small bowl. Stir to combine until smooth. Add water, 1/4 teaspoon at a time until desired consistency. Set ketchup aside.', 'Remove fries from oven and increase oven temperature to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Flip fries and return baking sheet to the hot oven. Bake until crispy, about 15 minutes more.', 'Serve celery root fries with harissa ketchup.']

Name: Chocolate Raspberry Cupcakes
Author: Reynolds KitchensR
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'baking cups', 'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'reynolds® staybrite®'}, {'ingredient': 'all-purpose flour', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'unsweetened cocoa powder', 'quantity': '0.75', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'baking soda', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'baking powder', 'quantity': '0.75', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'salt', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '0.75', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'softened'}, {'ingredient': 'granulated sugar', 'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'eggs', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'vanilla', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'milk', 'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'seedless raspberry preserves', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'raspberries', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'fresh', 'misc': 'for garnish'}, {'ingredient': 'cream cheese', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'softened 8 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'softened'}, {'ingredient': 'powdered sugar', 'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'seedless raspberry preserves', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['Reynolds® StayBrite® Baking Cups', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '0.75 cup unsweetened cocoa powder', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '0.75 teaspoon baking powder', '0.5 teaspoon salt', '0.75 cup butter, softened', '1.5 cups granulated sugar', '3 eggs', '2 teaspoons vanilla', '1.5 cups milk', '0.5 cup seedless raspberry preserves', 'Fresh raspberries, for garnish', '1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened', '0.5 cup butter, softened', '6 cups powdered sugar', '0.25 cup seedless raspberry preserves']
Instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line muffin pans with Reynolds® StayBrite® Baking Cups.', 'Stir together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl. In a large mixing bowl, beat the butter with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 30 seconds. Gradually add sugar, about 1/4 cup at a time, beating on medium speed until combined. Scrape sides of bowl  beat about 2 minutes more or until light and fluffy. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla. Alternately add the flour mixture and milk to the butter mixture, beating on low speed after each addition just until combined. Beat on medium to high speed for 20 seconds more.', 'Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups, filling each one-half to two-thirds full. Use the back of a spoon to smooth out batter in cups.', 'Bake about 18 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted in centers comes out clean. Cool cupcakes in muffin cups on wire racks for 5 minutes. Remove cupcakes from muffin pans. Cool completely on wire racks.', 'Use a small paring knife to remove a cone-shape piece of cupcake, going down only about one-third to one-half of the way into the cupcake. Fill each with 1 teaspoon preserves. Top with the removed portion of the cupcake, then with Raspberry Frosting and fresh raspberries.', 'Raspberry Frosting: Beat cream cheese and butter in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium to high speed until light and fluffy. Gradually add powdered sugar, beating until smooth. Gently fold in raspberry preserves.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '377 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '61 g', 'Cholesterol': '60 mg', 'Fiber': '1 g', 'Protein': '4 g', 'Saturated Fat': '9 g', 'Sodium': '228 mg', 'Sugar': '51 g', 'Fat': '14 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Southwestern Sausage Stuffing
Author: SunnyDaysNora
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'spray', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'cooking', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'jimmy premium pork regular sausage', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': '16 ounce dean®'}, {'ingredient': 'onion', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'diced'}, {'ingredient': 'poultry seasoning', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'salt', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cumin', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'chili powder', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'black pepper', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'cayenne pepper', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'oregano', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'dried'}, {'ingredient': 'sage', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'dried'}, {'ingredient': 'garlic powder', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'stale or toasted cornbread', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': 'crumbled'}, {'ingredient': 'rolls', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'bolillo', 'misc': 'diced and toasted 26 ounce mexican bread rolls'}, {'ingredient': 'creamed corn', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': '1475 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'chicken broth', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'green chiles', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': '4 ounce diced'}, {'ingredient': 'eggs', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'misc': 'lightly beaten'}, {'ingredient': 'cilantro', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'chopped'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['cooking spray', '1 (16 ounce) package Jimmy Dean® Premium Pork Regular Sausage', '1 cup diced onion', '2 teaspoons poultry seasoning', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '0.5 teaspoon ground black pepper', '0.5 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '0.5 teaspoon dried oregano', '0.5 teaspoon dried sage', '0.5 teaspoon garlic powder', '3 cups stale or toasted cornbread, crumbled', '3 (2.6 ounce) bolillo rolls (Mexican bread rolls), diced and toasted', '1 (14.75 ounce) can creamed corn', '1 cup chicken broth', '1 (4 ounce) can diced green chiles', '2 large eggs, lightly beaten', '0.25 cup chopped cilantro']
Instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray.', 'Add sausage to a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook and stir with a spatula, breaking apart the sausage until cooked, 5 to 7 minutes.', 'Mix poultry seasoning, salt, cumin, chili powder, black pepper, cayenne, oregano, sage, and garlic powder into the sausage mixture.', 'Combine cornbread crumbles and bolillo pieces in a large bowl. Mix in sausage mixture. Add creamed corn, chicken broth, green chiles, eggs, and cilantro  stir to combine.', 'Transfer stuffing mixture to the prepared baking dish. Cover with foil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. Uncover and continue to bake until golden, about 15 minutes more.']

Name: Pumpkin Bundt Cake with Rum Glaze
Author: Gilly
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'spray', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'cooking', 'misc': 'such as pam®'}, {'ingredient': 'pecans', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'yellow butter cake mix', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': '1525 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'pumpkin puree', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': '15 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'eggs', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'vegetable oil', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'such as wesson®'}, {'ingredient': 'water', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cinnamon', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'nutmeg', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'freshly grated'}, {'ingredient': 'pumpkin pie spice', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cloves', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stick', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'water', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'pumpkin pie spice', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'rum', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': '80 proof'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['cooking spray (such as Pam®)', '0.5 cup chopped pecans', '1 (15.25 ounce) package yellow butter cake mix', '1 (15 ounce) can pumpkin puree', '4 eggs', '0.5 cup white sugar', '0.5 cup vegetable oil (such as Wesson®)', '0.25 cup water', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '0.5 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', '0.25 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice', '0.25 teaspoon ground cloves', '1 stick butter', '1 cup white sugar', '0.25 cup water', '0.25 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice', '0.5 cup rum (80 proof)']
Instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).', 'Coat the inside of a fluted tube pan (such as Bundt) with cooking spray and sprinkle with chopped pecans.', 'Combine cake mix, pumpkin, eggs, sugar, oil, water, cinnamon, nutmeg, pumpkin pie spice, and cloves in a large bowl. Beat using an electric mixer until smooth and pour over nuts in the prepared tube pan. Tap the pan gently to release any air bubbles.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour.', 'Meanwhile, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in sugar, water, and pumpkin pie spice. Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and allow glaze to cool slightly, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in rum.', 'Remove cake from the oven and immediately turn out onto a plate. Poke small holes around the whole cake and quickly drizzle glaze over top and sides. Repeat using all of the glaze.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '491 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '57 g', 'Cholesterol': '83 mg', 'Fiber': '2 g', 'Protein': '5 g', 'Saturated Fat': '8 g', 'Sodium': '401 mg', 'Sugar': '42 g', 'Fat': '26 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Chocolate Zucchini Cupcakes
Author: tayoush
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'pecans', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'spray', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'cooking', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'zucchini', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': 'grated'}, {'ingredient': 'vegetable oil', 'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'eggs', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'all-purpose flour', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'unsweetened cocoa powder', 'quantity': '10', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'baking powder', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cinnamon', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'salt', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cream cheese', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'softened 8 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'salted butter', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'softened'}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'almond extract', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['1 cup pecans', '1 tablespoon butter', 'cooking spray', '3 cups grated zucchini', '1.5 cups vegetable oil', '3 eggs', '3 cups all-purpose flour', '3 cups white sugar', '10 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened', '0.5 cup salted butter, softened', '2 cups white sugar', '1 teaspoon almond extract']
Instructions: ["Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Spread pecans onto a baking sheet. Cut butter into small pieces and scatter on top of pecans.", 'Broil in the preheated oven until pecans start to turn golden brown and become fragrant, about 5 minutes, watching carefully to prevent burning. Remove from oven and allow to cool, about 10 minutes. Transfer pecans to a cutting board and smash or crush into small pieces.', 'Turn off broiler and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 18 cups of a muffin tin with paper liners. Spray inside of liners with cooking spray.', 'Combine zucchini, oil, and eggs in a large mixing bowl.', 'Mix flour, sugar, toasted pecans, sugar, cocoa powder, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl. Add zucchini mixture and stir to combine. Fill muffin tin cups 3/4 full with batter.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.', 'While cupcakes bake, cut softened cream cheese and butter into small pieces and place in a mixing bowl. Add sugar and almond extract. Mix icing using an electric mixer until smooth, about 5 minutes. Store in the refrigerator until use.', 'Remove cupcakes from the oven and let cool completely before frosting, about 1 hour.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '658 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '76 g', 'Cholesterol': '74 mg', 'Fiber': '3 g', 'Protein': '7 g', 'Saturated Fat': '13 g', 'Sodium': '313 mg', 'Sugar': '56 g', 'Fat': '39 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Instructions: ['Cover cashews with cold water in a bowl and soak for 2 to 3 hours or overnight. Drain.', 'Combine cashews, coconut milk, agave syrup, vanilla extract, and rose water in a blender  blend until smooth. Pour into a bowl and garnish with pomegranate seeds.']

Name: Esquites (Mexican Elotes Salad)
Author: CJ
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'olive oil', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'corn', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ears', 'misc': 'kernels cut from cob'}, {'ingredient': 'and black pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'shallot', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'misc': 'minced'}, {'ingredient': 'mayonnaise', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': 'or more to taste'}, {'ingredient': 'chile-lime seasoning', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'or more to taste such as tajin®'}, {'ingredient': 'pepper', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'jalapeno', 'misc': 'seeded and minced'}, {'ingredient': 'cilantro', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'chopped fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'cotija cheese', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'ounces', 'misc': 'crumbled'}, {'ingredient': 'lime', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'cut into wedges'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '4 ears corn, kernels cut from cob', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 small shallot, minced', '1 tablespoon mayonnaise, or more to taste', '1 teaspoon chile-lime seasoning (such as Tajin®), or more to taste', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '0.5 cup fresh cilantro, chopped', '2 ounces Cotija cheese, crumbled', '1 lime, cut into wedges']
Instructions: ['Heat oil in a large cast iron skillet over high heat until shimmering. Add corn kernels, in batches if necessary. Stir briefly  sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Cook, without stirring, until corn is slightly charred, about 2 minutes. Stir once and cook for 1 minute more. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Mix shallot, mayonnaise, and chile-lime seasoning together in a large bowl. Stir in the corn and jalapeno until well coated in dressing. Stir in 1/2 of the cilantro and Cotija cheese. Taste and season as desired. Top with the remaining cilantro. Serve each portion with a lime wedge.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '196 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '21 g', 'Cholesterol': '16 mg', 'Fiber': '3 g', 'Protein': '6 g', 'Saturated Fat': '4 g', 'Sodium': '336 mg', 'Sugar': '4 g', 'Fat': '12 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Quinoa with Chipotle-Lime Dressing
Author: Ashley Steele
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'olive oil', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'onion', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'quinoa', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'rinsed'}, {'ingredient': 'vegetable broth', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'black beans', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'rinsed and drained 15 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'tomato', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'bell pepper', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'yellow', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'avocado', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'diced'}, {'ingredient': 'firmly cilantro', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'packed chopped fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'lime', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'juiced'}, {'ingredient': 'olive oil', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'greek yogurt', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'chile pepper in adobo sauce', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'chipotle', 'misc': 'sauce reserved'}, {'ingredient': 'honey', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cumin', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'and black pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': 'ground'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, chopped', '1 cup quinoa, rinsed', '2 cups vegetable broth', '1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained', '1 large tomato, chopped', '1 yellow bell pepper, chopped', '1 avocado, diced', '0.5 cup firmly packed chopped fresh cilantro', '1 lime, juiced', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons Greek yogurt', '1 chipotle chile pepper in adobo sauce, sauce reserved', '1 tablespoon honey', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Instructions: ['Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Saute onion in hot oil until softened, about 5 minutes. Name: Warm Chocolate Peanut Butter Pudding Cake
Author: kokonut
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'spray', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'cooking', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'all-purpose flour', 'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'brown sugar', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'baking powder', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'baking soda', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'creamy peanut butter', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'sour cream', 'quantity': '0.75', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': 'melted'}, {'ingredient': 'almond extract', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'boiling water', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '0.75', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'unsweetened cocoa powder', 'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'boiling water', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'chocolate syrup', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['cooking spray', '1.5 cups all-purpose flour', '0.5 cup brown sugar', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '1 cup creamy peanut butter', '0.75 cup sour cream', '3 tablespoons butter, melted', '1 teaspoon almond extract', '2 tablespoons boiling water', '0.75 cup white sugar', '6 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder', '2 cups boiling water', '2 tablespoons chocolate syrup']
Instructions: ['Coat the inside of a slow cooker with cooking spray.', 'Whisk flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and baking soda together in a bowl. Whisk peanut butter, sour cream, melted butter, almond extract, and 2 tablespoons boiling water in a separate bowl until smooth. Stir flour mixture into peanut butter mixture to make a very thick batter. Scoop batter into prepared slow cooker.', 'Whisk white sugar, cocoa powder, and 2 cups of boiling water in a bowl until thoroughly combined. Pour chocolate mixture over batter in slow cooker.', 'Cook on High until cake begins to pull away from the sides of the cooker and feels firm on top, about 1 1/2 hours. Allow to cool 15 minutes before serving. Drizzle with chocolate syrup.']

Name: Sriracha Roasted Chicken
Author: monica69
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'sriracha chile sauce', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'soy sauce', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'mirin', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'japanese sweet wine'}, {'ingredient': 'lime juice', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': 'melted'}, {'ingredient': 'brown sugar', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': 'or more to taste'}, {'ingredient': 'ginger root', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': 'grated fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'thighs', 'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'chicken', 'misc': 'or more to taste'}, {'ingredient': 'spray', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'cooking', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cilantro', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': 'chopped fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'wedges', 'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'lime', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['0.5 cup Sriracha chile sauce', '0.25 cup soy sauce', '0.25 cup mirin (Japanese sweet wine)', '0.25 cup lime juice', '2 tablespoons butter, melted', '1 tablespoon brown sugar, or more to taste', '1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger root', '8 chicken thighs, or more to taste', 'cooking spray', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '8 lime wedges']
Instructions: ['Whisk Sriracha chile sauce, soy sauce, mirin, lime juice, butter, brown sugar, and ginger together in a bowl.', 'Put chicken thighs into a large, resealable plastic bag. Pour the chile sauce mixture into the bag. Squeeze excess air from bag and seal  marinate at least 1 hour to overnight.', 'Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Prepare a baking sheet with cooking spray.', 'Remove chicken thighs from marinade and shake to remove excess moisture  arrange onto prepared baking sheet.', 'Pour marinade into a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer marinade for 10 minutes.', 'Roast chicken thighs in preheated oven for 20 minutes, brush with the reserved marinade, and continue roasting until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, 10 to 15 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone, should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '220 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '7 g', 'Cholesterol': '78 mg', 'Fiber': '1 g', 'Protein': '20 g', 'Saturated Fat': '4 g', 'Sodium': '1173 mg', 'Sugar': '4 g', 'Fat': '11 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Quinoa Stuffed Pork Tenderloin
Author: cameal
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'quinoa', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'uncooked'}, {'ingredient': 'water', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'olive oil', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'onion', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'garlic', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'apples', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'misc': 'cored and chopped peeled'}, {'ingredient': 'raisins', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'pine nuts', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'mushrooms', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'white wine', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'tenderloin', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pork', 'misc': '1 pound'}, {'ingredient': 'cinnamon', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'garam masala', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'misc': 'or to taste'}, {'ingredient': 'and black pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': 'ground'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['0.25 cup uncooked quinoa', '0.5 cup water', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '0.5 onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 small apples - peeled, cored and chopped', '0.25 cup raisins', '2 tablespoons pine nuts', '4 mushrooms, chopped', '2 tablespoons white wine', '1 (1 pound) pork tenderloin', '1 pinch ground cinnamon', '1 pinch garam masala, or to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Instructions: ['Bring the quinoa and water to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until the quinoa is tender, and the water has been absorbed, about 15 minutes.', 'Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir the onion, garlic, apples, raisins, pine nuts, and mushrooms until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 8 minutes. Stir in the white wine, and cook another minute until the liquid has evaporated. Combine the apple mixture and quinoa until evenly mixed  set aside.', 'Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).', 'Cut the pork tenderloin from one side through the middle horizontally to within one-half inch of the other side. Open the two sides and spread them out like an open book. Place between two sheets of heavy plastic (resealable freezer bags work well) on a solid, level surface. Firmly pound the tenderloin with the smooth side of a meat mallet to a thickness of 1/2 inch.', 'Season the tenderloin on both sides with cinnamon, garam masala, salt, and black pepper. Spoon the quinoa filling onto the tenderloin, then roll up and secure with kitchen twine or toothpicks. Place onto a roasting pan.', 'Roast in the preheated oven until the pork is no longer pink in the center, about 35 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the filling should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C). Cover with aluminum foil, and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '282 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '21 g', 'Cholesterol': '49 mg', 'Fiber': '3 g', 'Protein': '21 g', 'Saturated Fat': '2 g', 'Sodium': '44 mg', 'Sugar': '9 g', 'Fat': '13 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Caramelized French Onion Dip
Author: CJ
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'olive oil', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'yellow onions', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': 'diced'}, {'ingredient': 'garlic', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'misc': 'minced'}, {'ingredient': 'water', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'or more if needed'}, {'ingredient': 'worcestershire sauce', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'beef base', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': 'such as better than bouillon®'}, {'ingredient': 'onion powder', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'thyme', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'dried'}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'and black pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'sour cream', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pint', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '3 cups diced yellow onions', '1 clove garlic, minced', '0.5 cup water, or more if needed', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 tablespoon beef base (such as Better than Bouillon®)', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '0.5 teaspoon dried thyme', '1 teaspoon white sugar', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 pint sour cream']
Instructions: ['Heat oil in a large saute pan over medium heat until shimmering, about 2 minutes. Add onions and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add 1/2 cup water, Worcestershire, beef base, onion powder, and thyme. Increase heat and bring to a boil, stirring constantly until beef base is dissolved.', 'Reduce heat to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, 30 to 45 minutes. Liquid will slowly evaporate and onions will caramelize. If onions start to stick to the pan, throw in a splash of water and scrape up the delicious bits. Taste before adding sugar, salt, and pepper. Once seasoned to your liking, remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature, 15 to 20 minutes.', 'Mix cooled onions with sour cream until well combined. Chill for 1 hour before serving.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '93 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '5 g', 'Cholesterol': '13 mg', 'Fiber': '1 g', 'Protein': '2 g', 'Saturated Fat': '4 g', 'Sodium': '217 mg', 'Sugar': '2 g', 'Fat': '8 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'figs', 'quantity': '2.25', 'unit': 'pounds', 'misc': 'fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'rum', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'rum', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'gelling sugar', 'quantity': '500', 'unit': 'g', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['2.25 pounds fresh figs', '0.5 cup rum', '2 tablespoons rum', '500g gelling sugar']
Instructions: ['Rinse figs well. Cut off stems and cut each fig in half or quarters, depending on their size.', 'Put figs and rum in a large pot over medium-high heat  bring to a light boil. Maintain a light boil and cook for 20 minutes. Stir in sugar, increase heat to high, and bring to a boil. Once boiling, cook for exactly 6 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, inspect 3 pint-sized jars for cracks and rings for rust, discarding any defective ones. Immerse in simmering water until fig preserves are ready. Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water.', 'Remove fig preserves from the heat and distribute evenly into the hot, sterilized jars, filling to within 1/4 inch of the top. Run a clean knife or thin spatula around the insides of the jars to remove any air bubbles. Wipe rims with a moist paper towel to remove any residue. Top with lids and screw rings on tightly. Put jars upside down on a clean cloth and leave until completely cool, 3 to 4 hours.', 'Store in a cool, dry place with no light.']

Name: Dark Chocolate Passover Brownies
Author: Lisa Katzoff
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'spray', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'cooking', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'unsalted butter', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'softened'}, {'ingredient': 'eggs', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'vanilla extract', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'salt', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'matzo cake meal', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'pound', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'unsweetened cocoa powder', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cinnamon', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'semisweet chocolate chips', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['cooking spray', '2 cups white sugar', '1 cup unsalted butter, softened', '4 eggs', '0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract', '0.5 teaspoon salt', '0.5 pound matzo cake meal', '1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder', '0.5 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 cup semisweet chocolate chips']
Instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan with cooking spray.', 'Beat sugar and butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium-high speed until light and fluffy. Add eggs, vanilla extract, and salt  mix until thoroughly combined. Mix in matzo meal, cocoa powder, and cinnamon with a wooden spoon. Switch to mixer and beat until batter is thoroughly combined and smooth, scraping sides of the bowl, 1 to 2 minutes. Fold in chocolate chips.', 'Pour batter into the center of the prepared pan  spread out evenly.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool in the pan, about 10 minutes. Slice into 18 squares and transfer to a serving plate. Place plate on a wire rack until brownies are thoroughly cooled, about 30 minutes.']

Name: Chicken Liver Pate with Currants
Author: Cheri
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'currants', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'dried'}, {'ingredient': 'brandy-based orange liqueur', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': 'such as grand marnier®'}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'divided'}, {'ingredient': 'onion', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'finely chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'garlic', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'misc': 'minced'}, {'ingredient': 'chicken livers', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'misc': 'trimmed'}, {'ingredient': 'heavy whipping cream', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'thyme', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'dried'}, {'ingredient': 'allspice', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'and black pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': 'ground'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['0.5 cup dried currants', '2 tablespoons brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®)', '1 cup butter, divided', '1 onion, finely chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 pounds chicken livers, trimmed', '0.5 cup heavy whipping cream', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '0.5 teaspoon ground allspice', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Instructions: ['Place currants in a small bowl  cover with orange liqueur. Let soak until plump, about 1 hour.', 'Melt 1/4 cup butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion and garlic in the hot butter until softened, about 1 minute. Add chicken livers  cook and stir until no longer pink in the center, 5 to 8 minutes.', 'Place remaining 3/4 cup butter, chicken liver mixture, heavy cream, thyme, and allspice in a food processor  blend until smooth. Transfer to a bowl and stir in currants and orange liqueur. Season pate with salt and pepper.', 'Divide pate among small ramekins. Refrigerate until firm, at least 3 hours.']

Name: Mexican Lasagna with Cactus
Author: The Jazz Chef
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'spray', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'cooking', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'beef', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'pounds', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'taco seasoning mix', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'envelopes', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'enchilada sauce', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'divided 28 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'flour tortillas', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'cut in half - divided 15 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'fat-free refried beans', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'misc': '16 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'queso fresco', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'thinly sliced - divided 12 ounce mexican cheese'}, {'ingredient': 'reduced-fat mexican cheese blend', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'divided 16 ounce shredded'}, {'ingredient': 'nopalitos', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'jar', 'misc': 'drained - divided 16 ounce sliced cactus'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['cooking spray', '4 pounds ground beef', '2 envelopes taco seasoning mix', '1 (28 ounce) can enchilada sauce, divided', '4 (15 ounce) packages flour tortillas, cut in half - divided', '2 (16 ounce) cans fat-free refried beans', '2 (12 ounce) packages queso fresco (Mexican cheese), thinly sliced - divided', '2 (16 ounce) packages shredded reduced-fat Mexican cheese blend, divided', '1 (16 ounce) jar nopalitos (sliced cactus), drained - divided']
Instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a large disposable aluminum roasting pan with cooking spray.', 'Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat, breaking the meat into crumbles as it browns, 10 to 12 minutes. Drain excess grease and stir in taco seasoning and half the enchilada sauce. Reserve remaining enchilada sauce for later use. Bring beef mixture to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes. Set meat aside.', 'Layer one package of tortillas into the bottom of the prepared aluminum roasting pan and spread refried beans evenly in a layer over the tortillas. Arrange 1 more package of halved tortillas over the beans, and top with slices of queso fresco. Spread 1 package of reduced-fat Mexican cheese blend over queso fresco slices. Lay half the sliced nopalitos in a criss-cross pattern over the shredded cheese.', 'Top nopalito layer with 1 more package of tortillas and spread beef mixture over the tortillas  top with remaining package of tortillas. Finish casserole with remaining enchilada sauce and remaining 1 package cheese blend. Top the cheese with remaining nopalito slices arranged in a criss-cross pattern.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is bubbling and the cheese topping is melted and starting to brown, 25 to 30 minutes. Serve in squares.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '778 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '79 g', 'Cholesterol': '89 mg', 'Fiber': '7 g', 'Protein': '53 g', 'Saturated Fat': '9 g', 'Sodium': '1787 mg', 'Sugar': '4 g', 'Fat': '25 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Watermelon Pops
Author: Philadelphia
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'sugar', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'jell-o lime flavor gelatin', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': '3 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'boiling water', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': 'divided'}, {'ingredient': 'cubes', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'ice', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'water', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'divided cold'}, {'ingredient': 'jell-o strawberry flavor gelatin', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': '3 ounce'}, {'ingredient': 'miniature semi-sweet chocolate chips', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'philadelphia cream cheese', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ounces', 'misc': 'softened'}, {'ingredient': 'cool whip whipped topping', 'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': 'thawed'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['1 cup sugar', '1 (3 ounce) package JELL-O Lime Flavor Gelatin', '2 cups boiling water, divided', 'Ice cubes', '1 cup cold water, divided', '1 (3 ounce) package JELL-O Strawberry Flavor Gelatin', '3 tablespoons miniature semi-sweet chocolate chips', '4 ounces PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese, softened', '1.5 cups thawed COOL WHIP Whipped Topping']
Instructions: ['Mix 1/3 cup sugar and lime gelatin mix in medium bowl. Add 1 cup boiling water  stir 2 min. until completely dissolved. Add enough ice to 1/2 cup cold water to measure 3/4 cup. Add to lime gelatin  stir until ice is completely melted. Refrigerate 25 min.', 'Meanwhile, repeat Step 1 using strawberry gelatin mix and omitting the refrigeration step. Pour into 16 (3-oz.) paper cups. Freeze 20 min. Stir 1/2 tsp. chocolate chips into gelatin in each cup.', 'Beat cream cheese and remaining sugar with mixer in medium bowl until well blended. Stir in COOL WHIP  spread over gelatin in cups.', 'Pour lime gelatin over cream cheese mixture. Insert wooden pop stick into gelatin in center of each cup. Freeze 3 hours or until firm. Remove pops from cups just before serving.']

Author: Kelly Rogers
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'whole tomatoes', 'quantity': '2.5', 'unit': 'quarts', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'onion', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'yellow', 'misc': 'diced'}, {'ingredient': 'extra-virgin olive oil', 'quantity': '0.75', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'divided'}, {'ingredient': 'and black pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': 'freshly ground'}, {'ingredient': 'tomato juice', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': 'fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'garlic', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'misc': 'minced'}, {'ingredient': 'bell pepper', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'green', 'misc': 'finely chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'bell pepper', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'red', 'misc': 'finely chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'peppers', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'banana', 'misc': 'finely chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'chicken broth', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'heavy cream', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'basil', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'chopped fresh'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['2.5 quarts whole tomatoes', '0.25 yellow onion, diced', '0.75 cup extra-virgin olive oil , divided', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '2 cups fresh tomato juice', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 green bell pepper, finely chopped', '1 red bell pepper, finely chopped', '2 banana peppers, finely chopped', '2 cups chicken broth', '0.25 cup white sugar', '3 tablespoons butter', '0.5 cup heavy cream', '0.25 cup chopped fresh basil']
Instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).', 'Place tomatoes and onion on a rimmed baking sheet  drizzle with about 1/4 cup olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.', 'Roast in the preheated oven until well browned and softened, about 15 minutes. Let cool until ready to use.', 'Heat remaining olive oil and tomato juice in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Simmer over low heat until heated through, about 15 minutes. Garnish with basil.']

Name: Sweet Potato Pan Dumplings with Bacon Butter
Author: John Mitzewich
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'sweet potato', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'egg', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'goat cheese', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'black pepper', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'freshly', 'misc': 'ground'}, {'ingredient': 'pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'cayenne', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'kosher salt', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'or to taste'}, {'ingredient': 'self-rising flour', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': 'or to taste'}, {'ingredient': 'bacon', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'misc': 'diced'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['1 large sweet potato', '1 large egg', '0.25 cup goat cheese', 'freshly ground black pepper', 'cayenne pepper to taste', '1 teaspoon kosher salt, or to taste', '0.5 cup self-rising flour', '2 tablespoons butter, or to taste', '4 slices bacon, diced']
Instructions: ['Place sweet potato on a microwave-safe plate. Poke holes all over and microwave until completely tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Let cool briefly.', 'Cut sweet potato in half and scoop flesh into a bowl. Mash thoroughly while still warm. Add egg, goat cheese, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and salt. Whisk until well combined.
