Name: Coffee Roast
Author: Arrianna and Tom
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'chuck roast', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'pounds', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'onion', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'brewed coffee', 'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'canned mushrooms', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'cornstarch', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['2 tablespoons butter', '4 pounds chuck roast', '1 tablespoon butter', 'salt to taste', '1 onion, chopped', '6 cups brewed coffee', '2 cups canned mushrooms', '3 tablespoons cornstarch']
Instructions: ['Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a large saucepan over medium high heat. Add the roast and sear on all sides until well browned  set aside.', 'In the same saucepan, melt the remaining butter, add the salt and onions and saute for 5 minutes. Return the meat to the saucepan and pour in the coffee and the mushrooms.', 'Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 hours, turning meat over halfway through cooking time.', 'To make gravy: Remove a cup of the coffee mixture from the saucepan, combine with the cornstarch, stirring until smooth, and return to the simmering pan. Mix well, remove from heat and serve.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '703 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '8 g', 'Cholesterol': '212 mg', 'Fiber': '2 g', 'Protein': '60 g', 'Saturated Fat': '20 g', 'Sodium': '501 mg', 'Sugar': '2 g', 'Fat': '47 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Greek-Style Potatoes
Author: Cathie
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'potatoes', 'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'peeled and quartered'}, {'ingredient': 'water', 'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'olive oil', 'quantity': '0.33333334326744', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'lemon juice', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'garlic', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'misc': 'finely chopped'}, {'ingredient': 'chicken bouillon', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cubes', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'thyme', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'dried'}, {'ingredient': 'rosemary', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'dried'}, {'ingredient': 'black pepper to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'ground', 'misc': ''}]

Instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Arrange potatoes evenly in the bottom of a medium baking dish.', 'Mix water, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, bouillon cubes, thyme, rosemary, and pepper together in a small bowl. Name: Grand Marnier® Scallops Appetizer with Fois Gras
Author: Linda Loves Food
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'sea scallops', 'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'large', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'brandy-based orange liqueur', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'such as grand marnier®'}, {'ingredient': 'textured pate', 'quantity': '2.5', 'unit': 'ounces', 'misc': 'sliced such as foie gras finely'}, {'ingredient': 'salt and black pepper', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'sea', 'misc': 'to taste freshly ground'}, {'ingredient': 'seville orange marmalade', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'or more to taste'}, {'ingredient': 'unsalted butter', 'quantity': '1.5', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'watercress', 'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'misc': 'rinsed and dried'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['6 large sea scallops', '0.25 cup brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®)', '2.5 ounces finely textured pate (such as foie gras), sliced', 'sea salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste', '0.25 cup Seville orange marmalade, or more to taste', '1.5 tablespoons unsalted butter', '6 sprigs watercress, rinsed and dried']
Instructions: ['Rinse scallops and pat dry with paper towel. Pour all but 1 tablespoon Grand Marnier® into a glass or ceramic bowl and add scallops  marinate for 1 hour. Reserve remaining 1 tablespoon Grand Marnier®.', 'Drain scallops and pat with paper towels until very dry. Let rest at least 15 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper on both sides. Sprinkle fois gras slice with salt and pepper on both sides.', 'Combine Seville orange marmalade and reserved Grand Marnier® in a small nonstick pot over very low heat until marmalade has thickened and has the consistency of chutney, 5 to 10 minutes.', 'Melt butter in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until it sizzles. Add scallops and pan-fry until well caramelized, 1 to 2 minutes. Flip scallops and pan-fry for 1 more minute. Remove from heat and transfer to a serving plate.', 'Meanwhile, quickly sear fois gras in a small nonstick saucepan over medium-high heat on both sides, about 30 to 40 seconds per side  do not overcook! Remove from heat and transfer to a small plate. Cut into 6 equal pieces with a sharp knife.', 'To assemble, top each scallop with a slice of fois gras, 1/2 teaspoon marmalade, and a sprig of watercress.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '196 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '16 g', 'Cholesterol': '57 mg', 'Fiber': '0 g', 'Protein': '7 g', 'Saturated Fat': '4 g', 'Sodium': '236 mg', 'Sugar': '12 g', 'Fat': '10 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Strawberry Orange Rhubarb Cake
Author: Cathy H
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'rhubarb', 'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'stalks', 'misc': 'cut into 12 inch pieces'}, {'ingredient': 'strawberries', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pint', 'misc': 'hulled and sliced'}, {'ingredient': 'white sugar', 'quantity': '1.3333333730698', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': 'divided'}, {'ingredient': 'butter', 'quantity': '0.33333334326744', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': 'softened'}, {'ingredient': 'egg', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'orange zest', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'misc': 'grated'}, {'ingredient': 'vanilla extract', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'all-purpose flour', 'quantity': '1.25', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'baking powder', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'baking soda', 'quantity': '0.5', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'salt', 'quantity': '0.125', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'buttermilk', 'quantity': '0.75', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['6 stalks rhubarb, cut into 1/2 inch pieces', '1 pint strawberries, hulled and sliced', '1.3333333730698 cups white sugar, divided', '0.33333334326744 cup butter, softened', '1 egg', '2 teaspoons grated orange zest', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1.25 cups all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '0.5 teaspoon baking soda', '0.125 teaspoon salt', '0.75 cup buttermilk']
Instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch square baking dish.', 'Place rhubarb and strawberries into a large bowl. Stir in 2/3 cup sugar until fruit is evenly coated. Pour into the prepared baking dish and spread to cover the bottom.', 'Beat together butter and remaining 2/3 cup sugar in another large bowl until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Mix in egg, orange zest, and vanilla until well combined. Stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl  stir into egg mixture, alternating with buttermilk. Pour batter over fruit in the dish.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 55 minutes.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '276 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '49 g', 'Cholesterol': '40 mg', 'Fiber': '2 g', 'Protein': '4 g', 'Saturated Fat': '5 g', 'Sodium': '236 mg', 'Sugar': '33 g', 'Fat': '8 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Heirloom Tomato Soup
Author: Brandy Kozloski
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'heirloom tomatoes', 'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'medium', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'oil', 'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': 'or as needed'}, {'ingredient': 'white onion', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'misc': 'chopped divided'}, {'ingredient': 'garlic', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'misc': 'minced divided'}, {'ingredient': 'italian seasoning', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': 'or to taste'}, {'ingredient': 'chicken stock', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'tomatoes', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': '15 ounce crushed'}, {'ingredient': 'to taste', 'quantity': '', 'unit': 'salt', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'spinach', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'misc': '8 ounce fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'mozzarella cheese', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'ball', 'misc': 'cut into bite-sized cubes 8 ounce'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['8 medium heirloom tomatoes', '3 tablespoons oil, or as needed', '1 medium white onion, chopped, divided', '2 cloves garlic, minced, divided', '0.25 teaspoon Italian seasoning, or to taste', '2 cups chicken stock', '1 (15 ounce) can crushed tomatoes', 'salt to taste', '1 (8 ounce) package fresh spinach', '1 (8 ounce) ball mozzarella cheese, cut into bite-sized cubes']
Instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Cut tomatoes in half and put on a baking sheet.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. Turn on the broiler and broil for 5 minutes. Remove from the oven.', 'Put enough oil in a large pot to cover the bottom. Add 2/3 of the onion, 1/2 of the garlic, and Italian seasoning  sizzle over low heat for 10 minutes.', 'Place roasted tomatoes and chicken stock in a large pot. Mix well and cook over medium heat for 30 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes, cover, and reduce heat to low  cook for 2 to 3 hours.', 'Ten minutes before the soup is ready, heat 1 teaspoon oil in a skillet over medium heat  stir in remaining onion. Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Add remaining garlic and saute until fragrant, about 1 minutes. Add spinach and salt  cook until wilted, 2 to 3 minutes.', "Meanwhile, set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.", 'Pour soup into individual ceramic bowls. Place spinach mixture and mozzarella cubes on top of each soup.', 'Place soups in the preheated oven and broil until cheese is melted, 3 to 4 minutes. Serve immediately.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '230 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '17 g', 'Cholesterol': '24 mg', 'Fiber': '5 g', 'Protein': '13 g', 'Saturated Fat': '5 g', 'Sodium': '595 mg', 'Sugar': '6 g', 'Fat': '14 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}

Name: Sous Vide Maple-Glazed Carrots
Author: lutzflcat
Ingredients: [{'ingredient': 'carrots', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'misc': 'peeled'}, {'ingredient': 'unsalted butter', 'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': 'divided'}, {'ingredient': 'chicken broth', 'quantity': '0.25', 'unit': 'cup', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'maple syrup', 'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'lime juice', 'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'thyme', 'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'misc': 'fresh'}, {'ingredient': 'cayenne pepper', 'quantity': '0.125', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'misc': ''}, {'ingredient': 'maldonreg sea salt flakes', 'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'misc': 'optional'}]
Ingredients_Raw: ['1 pound carrots, peeled', '4 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided', '0.25 cup chicken broth', '2 tablespoons maple syrup', '1 tablespoon lime juice', '6 sprigs fresh thyme', '0.125 teaspoon cayenne pepper', 'Maldon® sea salt flakes (optional)']
Instructions: ['Prepare a water bath with an immersion circulator set to 185 degrees F (85 degrees C).', 'Cut carrots in half lengthwise and slice into 1/2-inch thick pieces on the bias/diagonal.', 'Place carrots, 2 tablespoons of butter, chicken broth, maple syrup, lime juice, thyme sprigs, and cayenne pepper into a resealable freezer bag or a vacuum seal bag. Seal the bag, and press out as much air as possible, then place into another freezer bag, press out all the air, and seal.', 'Lower the bag into the water bath until bag is completely submerged, then clip the bag to the side of the container. Be prepared to weigh the bag down if you see it starting to float. Cover the water bath container with aluminum foil to retain heat and minimize evaporation, and cook until carrots are tender, about 70 minutes.', 'Drain carrots through a fine mesh strainer set over a medium skillet  transfer carrots to a bowl and set aside.', 'Place the skillet over medium heat and bring the liquid to a simmer. Cook until it is reduced to about 3 tablespoons, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove the skillet from the heat and whisk in remaining 2 tablespoons butter, stirring until sauce is smooth and shiny.', 'Add carrots to the skillet, tossing gently to combine, and season with a sprinkle of salt flakes. Serve warm.']
Nutrition: {'Calories': '179 kcal', 'Carbohydrates': '18 g', 'Cholesterol': '31 mg', 'Fiber': '4 g', 'Protein': '1 g', 'Saturated Fat': '7 g', 'Sodium': '154 mg', 'Sugar': '12 g', 'Fat': '12 g', 'Unsaturated Fat': '0 g'}
